intro: Danais clematidea, commonly known as the purple clematis, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its climbing habit and produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from purple to blue. The plant features opposite, simple leaves that are usually ovate or elliptic in shape. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Danais clematidea is native to parts of Africa and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates.
